title: I'm so sorry Caitlyn Mains...
body:
CertainlyT's got his clutches on your champion and soon she'll get Mordekaisered (yes, that's a term.)

NEW PASSIVE; We want to entice Caitlyn into solo lanes to piss off melees so she'll only gain 50% of the experience when near an ally.

replies.body: The full scope of Caitlyn's changes is actually quite low, and from at least what I've played of it in the last few weeks, she's a lot of fun in interesting ways despite not changing too much.

> [{quoted}](name=AtheosisX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6Uwtyaag,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-09-22T18:42:42.833+0000)
>
> No she isn't.  She's just balanced.  Why do LoL players call every champion who isn't overpowered weak?

Because she is weak, her only shining grace is her early game and even that is rather meph. Her mid to late game is easily the weakest compared to every other ADC in the game because she has no reliable steroids in her kit besides her headshot. She doesn't even excel at anything besides long range kill but besides that, she is meph at best.

I watched Dlift's proguide on Caitlyn. He said that:

 You should end lane with a 20-30 cs lead. Her late game is fine, her mid game is where she falls through. She has a really weak steroid and can't 1v1 well.  During the mid game she should always be grouping.  Her traps and range give her fantastic objective control, so she is usually brought for that.

cait is my main adc and I think this summary is perfectly true. Her late game actually isnt bad....maybe its supposed to be on paper but her autoattack range and dash somehow makes it work. I dont know really...somehow its good. Ive beaten late game vayne with lategame cait 1v1 plenty of times. But yeah mid game she has issues.

The cs lead thing...its depending on the support. for example if the opps have soraka support thats painful.

Caitlyn is really good in lane, people just need to be able to get that balance of harassing safely and cs'ing, which a lot of people have trouble with. Cait's late is also much better since they added the armor pen into her headshot, and as long as the opponent doesn't get the jump on her late she should be fine. Mid is definitely her weakest point though, since unless she has a lead her auto's aren't going to be that strong and she won't be in a position to siege.

I main both and still feel like Caitlyn is good. Mostly because people love to pick Caitlyn if I pick Vayne early. Good Caitlyns make you FEEL every cs you try to take. I find myself worrying less about when to last hit the minion and more about if I can even afford to go for the cs.

She is good yes but look.

Few days ago I played Caitlyn vs Vayne and I had over 30 minions CS lead and 3-0 score, killed her bard twice and killed her once, I had tier 1 boots, IE and almost finished PD, what happened next is that Vayne with ONLY tier 2 boots and BorK ulted on me out of the bush, missed her condemn, soacked my Q and even tho I didn't miss literally anything she killed me with ease. She was left with close to 30% hp :)

Random ass invulnerabilities

Probably a true % max hp damage ult (its a headshot or something?) 

and a passive that makes her dash cooldowns decrease every time she is hit because shes a "sniper"... but decreases her attack damage by 1% for balance

Looking at what he was suggesting in terms of changing Caitlyn, I kind of like the direction he's going.  Heading towards a more defensive play style, with more safety then live.  I'm fine sacrificing damage for relative safety, since that's typically what I want on an adc.  

But, as we all know, once the changes hit PBE, all of the "mains" will show up out of nowhere complaining about the changes / CertainlyT.

Just a heads up; A rioter told us Mordekaiser mains Morde will have more sustained damage, be more tanky and generally stay the same after his rework that was bound to hit the PBE in a month's time.
What we got wasn't what we were promised so I'd be skeptical until you see the actual changes.

Still, I hope she'll be better off than good ol' Morde
If CertainlyT does the same amount of effort with Caitlyn as he did with Mordekaiser, I'll be happy.
You will be happy? So you are happy when champions get destroyed and forced to do something?

Forced is a strong word.  He's certainly stronger in a duo lane, but isn't forced.  I still believe that Mordekaisers core is there, as is his main concept, his ultimate.  I'm still amazed how much they buffed his ult honestly.  

In reference to Caitlyn, she has a fun kit, but I do feel like there could be changes that bring her more in line with the core concept of being the "sniper" in league.  At the very least, CertainlyT should at least get to voice his opinion before G&B downvotes everything he says without reading it.

No, he shouldnt. He created Kalista, he created Darius, he created Yasuo, he created thresh, he reworked mordekaiser. And he never took our feedback even after we read what he said and replied contsructively (this is especially appareant in Morde thread).

I would trust fcking anyone, even Phreak more than CertainlyT.


And yes, Morderkaiser was forced. His q is impposible to use solo because of his immobility, his w wasnt usable in solo lane either. His wave clear was cut down. But people with small brains look at that dragon ghost and say "WOOOOWW DATS COOL REWORK".

Look at his winrates in all other lanes than bot lane. Look at them before the rework and after, you will see a difference.

I suppose this is a bad time to mention, I actually enjoy Kalista.  Annoying, but good for the game, having an ADC that scales with AS instead of crit is a good step imo.  I'll admit, it's been ages since I went against a good Kalista, and I rarely play Singed / Volibear, beyond the point though.

I'm starting to assume that for the most part, Riot tends to avoid suggestions pre-rework phase.  Similar circumstances happened with Cass, and I'll assume other champions before.  In turn, Cass did undergo numerous changes before this live version, and Mordekaiser did get a poor self casted W back.  Neither was everything the community wanted, but it was something.  

Q was always impossible to use with his mobility.  It was mainly wave clear, or excess poke against melees.  It was incredibly rare for a ranged mid to be close enough to get splashed by the AOE.  The change seems more like a power shift then a nerf imo, but opinions.  I'll admit, I do enjoy the rework, more from the fact that he's more based around getting a ghost, and holding it, but dragons pretty cool as well.

Win rates, statistics.  I love these things.  Which site do you use?  I know a lot of people lost faith in Champion.gg after their first mistake with Mordekaiser, and I kind of question if that has happened again.  But, assuming that they're accurate, mid mordekaiser has completely fallen off.  Now, I have to wonder why.  62% ban rate might be a cause, coupled with the assumption that he's only viable as a duo laner.  Still, I doubt that the playstyle completely fell off.  I'm not sure this is the best patch to look at statistics for honestly.  Riot made a statement somewhere that they believe Darius is fine, and want to wait out, so that people can play against him and realize that.  

Again, I'm getting off topic.  It's a shame you're on EUNE, and a lot of other people complaining about Morde aren't on NA.  I'd be more than willing to play a game or two, and see if Morde was still viable in other lanes.
